abstract: Amazon, Microsoft and Yahoo are planning to join a coalition opposing a proposed class-action settlement giving Google the rights to commercialize digital copies of millions of books.
snippet: Amazon, Microsoft and Yahoo are planning to join a coalition opposing a proposed class-action settlement giving Google the rights to commercialize digital copies of millions of books.
lead_paragraph: Amazon, Microsoft and Yahoo are planning to join a coalition of nonprofit groups, individuals and library associations to oppose a proposed class-action settlement giving Google the rights to commercialize digital copies of millions of books, The New York Times’s Miguel Helft reported.

headline.main: Google Rivals Will Oppose Book Settlement

abstract: Apple’s response to the F.C.C. inquiry into the rejection of the Google Voice iPhone app cracked the veneer of the App Store review process.
snippet: Apple’s response to the F.C.C. inquiry into the rejection of the Google Voice iPhone app cracked the veneer of the App Store review process.
lead_paragraph: On Friday, Apple, along with AT&T and Google, filed responses to the Federal Communications Commission‘s inquiry into Apple’s rejection of an iPhone application developed by Google.

headline.main: Apple Lifts the Curtain on App Store Approvals

abstract: Apple told the F.C.C. it is still studying the iPhone application, in part because of privacy concerns.
snippet: Apple told the F.C.C. it is still studying the iPhone application, in part because of privacy concerns.
lead_paragraph: Apple told the Federal Communications Commission on Friday that it did not reject an iPhone application submitted by Google and that it was still studying it, in part because of privacy concerns.

headline.main: Apple Denies It Rejected Google Application for iPhone
headline.print_headline: Apple Tells F.C.C. It Is ‘Still Pondering’ Google Voice Application for the iPhone
